concept.title: Student Address Types at NC State University
concept.shortdesc: NC State University maintains several types of addresses for students to ensure accurate records and communication.

conbody.p: The university collects and maintains various address types for students, each serving a specific purpose:

ul.li: Home Address: Used for mailing purposes, this should be where you want to receive your mail. It can be a PO Box.
Permanent Address: This address persists beyond your attendance at the university. It may be a parent's address or your own permanent address.
Local Address: This should be your physical living location while attending NC State. It's used for emergency contact and is verified each term.
Campus Housing Address: Automatically populated for students living in University-managed housing. Students cannot edit this address.
Diploma Address: The address where your diploma will be mailed upon graduation. If not provided, the diploma is sent to your Home Address.
SEVIS Local Address: For international students, this address is sent to SEVIS and should match your Local Address.
SEVIS Foreign Address: For international students, this is your home foreign address, populated based on admission information.

conbody.p: Regularly updating these addresses ensures that the university can maintain accurate records and communicate effectively with students.
